etymologies: mid 17th century; earliest use found in Robert Lovell (?1630–1690), naturalist. Probably from post-classical Latin revellent-, revellens (although this is apparently first attested slightly later: 1666), use as noun of neuter of classical Latin revellent-, revellēns, present participle of revellere revel

definitions: A medicine or treatment used to produce revulsion; = "revulsive".
